parser.ast

Class Update

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.ast.ASTElement
      • parser.ast.Update

  • public class Update
extends ASTElement
    Class to store a single update, i.e. a list of assignments of variables to expressions, e.g. (s'=1)&(x'=x+1)

      • update

        public Values update(Values constantValues,
                     Values oldValues)
              throws PrismLangException
        Execute this update, based on variable values specified as a Values object, returning the result as a new Values object copied from the existing one. Values of any constants should also be provided.
        Parameters:
        constantValues - Values for constants
        oldValues - Variable values in current state
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • update

        public void update(Values constantValues,
                   Values oldValues,
                   Values newValues)
            throws PrismLangException
        Execute this update, based on variable values specified as a Values object, applying changes in variables to a second Values object. Values of any constants should also be provided.
        Parameters:
        constantValues - Values for constants
        oldValues - Variable values in current state
        newValues - Values object to apply changes to
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • update

        public State update(State oldState)
             throws PrismLangException
        Execute this update, based on variable values specified as a State object, returning the result as a new State object copied from the existing one. It is assumed that any constants have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        oldState - Variable values in current state
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • update

        public void update(State oldState,
                   State newState)
            throws PrismLangException
        Execute this update, based on variable values specified as a State object. Apply changes in variables to a provided copy of the State object. (i.e. oldState and newState should be equal when passed in) It is assumed that any constants have already been defined.
        Arithmetic expressions are evaluated using the default evaluate (i.e., not using exact arithmetic)
        Parameters:
        oldState - Variable values in current state
        newState - State object to apply changes to
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • update

        public void update(State oldState,
                   State newState,
                   boolean exact)
            throws PrismLangException
        Execute this update, based on variable values specified as a State object. Apply changes in variables to a provided copy of the State object. (i.e. oldState and newState should be equal when passed in) It is assumed that any constants have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        oldState - Variable values in current state
        newState - State object to apply changes to
        exact - evaluate arithmetic expressions exactly?
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • updatePartially

        public void updatePartially(State oldState,
                            State newState,
                            int[] varMap)
                     throws PrismLangException
        Execute this update, based on variable values specified as a State object. Apply changes in variables to a provided copy of the State object. (i.e. oldState and newState should be equal when passed in.) Both State objects represent only a subset of the total set of variables, with this subset being defined by the mapping varMap. Only variables in this subset are updated. But if doing so requires old values for variables outside the subset, this will cause an exception. It is assumed that any constants have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        oldState - Variable values in current state
        newState - State object to apply changes to
        varMap - A mapping from indices (over all variables) to the subset (-1 if not in subset).
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • checkUpdate

        public State checkUpdate(State oldState,
                         VarList varList)
                  throws PrismLangException
        Check whether this update (from a particular state) would cause any errors, mainly variable overflows. Variable ranges are specified in the passed in VarList. Throws an exception if such an error occurs.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException
